page.title: 19WHAT CONCERNS NEWHAVEN FOLK
page.content: To discover the attitudes of Newhaven people we compiled a questionnaire which was completed by a cross-section of the population. There was concern about local flooding from the Ouse and a desire for flood barriers. The closure of the Valley Hospital also evoked criticism. People were pleased that Fort Newhaven had been restored but considered its charges excessive. Worries about young people seemed widespread: many felt parental discipline was lax and that vandalism was increasing. People believed that everyone should be able to work even if only part-time. We found disappointment at the sale of the ferry Senlac to the French and a desire for more shops in Newhaven, but a general satisfaction with life in the town.
